pdist_notes: 2020-03-12: Meetings of >100 people cancelled and people encouraged to work from home (citation 1); 2020-03-15: Schools, restaurants, fitness clubs etc. closed (citation 2)
2020-03-13: Spain issues state of emergency (came into effect 2020-03-14) - schools had already closed, as had cinemas, theatres and playgrounds

2020-03-08: German Health Minister recommended to cancel events of more than 1000 attendees; 2020-03-13: German states mandate school and kindergarden closures, postponing academic semesters and prohibiting visits to nursing homes. 2220-03-15: borders to neighbouring countries closed; 2020-03-22: curfew enacted, ban on gatherings of more than 2 people

2020-03-16: PM says everyone should avoid office, pubs and travelling (citation 1); 2020-03-18: UK would close schools to most pupils - started 2020-03-20 (citation 2); 2020-03-20: All restaurants and indoor sport and leisure facilities were ordered to close (citation 3); 2020-03-23: restrictions tightened, gatherings banned >2 people (citation 4/5)
2020-03-15: GathRest25 (into effect 2020-03-17)
2020-03-10: Belgian government cancels all indoor gatherings over 1,000 people, including concerts, sports competitions, and trade fairs.
2020-03-16: GathRest50 (into effect 2020-03-18)

2020-03-06: Large assemblies >1000 people encouraged to cancel (citation 1); 2020-03-12: bans on >100 people banned (citation 2); 2020-03-13: Danish public employees sent home for 2 weeks; 2020-03-17: police prohibited public gatherings with more than 10 people and ordered all restaurants, cafes and hairdressers to shut down

2020-03-08: German Health Minister recommended to cancel events of more than 1000 attendees; 2020-03-13: German states mandate school and kindergarden closures, postponing academic semesters and prohibiting visits to nursing homes. 2220-03-15: borders to neighbouring countries closed; 2020-03-22: curfew enacted, ban on gatherings of more than 2 people

Preface: See Lancet article - refers to social distancing as beginning in late January - aligns with declaration of emergency and implementation of travel restrictions (Guardian piece suggests that changes came into effect early Feb)... full timeline: 2020-01-25: Declared outbreak an "emergency" (highest warning tier) - travel restrictions from Wuhan, schools would not return after lunar new year holiday, string of public events cancelled (schools have been closed since before March 2); **2020-01-29**: starting today, the following Leisure and Cultural Services Department facilities will be closed: land sports facilities, acquatic facilities, meuseums, performance venues, public libraries, music centres; 2020-03-19: mandatory 14-day quarantine for all incoming travellers; 2020-03-27: Bans public gatherings of >4 people + closures of gyms, entertainment facilities (citation 6)
citation_3: Leisure and Cultural Services Department Closures: https://www.lcsd.gov.hk/clpss/en/webApp/NewsDetails.do?id=14683; https://fortune.com/2020/03/19/coronavirus-hong-kong-quarantine-tracking/
citation_7: People were not required to stay home, but as of March 2020, 99% wore face masks out of the house and 85% avoided crowded places: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanpub/article/PIIS2468-2667(20)30090-6/fulltext#fig1; https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/17/test-trace-lessons-hong-kong-avoiding-coronavirus-lockdown

pdist_notes: 2020-03-12: ; 2020-03-16: Suspended public prayers at mosques, shut down hamams, closed spaces where people tend to mingle (tea houses, clubs, concert venues, cafes, gyms, theatres, cinemas, etc.) - begins 2020-03-17 (Tuesday) (citation 1 and 2) - no state of emergency declared, Health minister urges citizens to 'declare own emergency rule' (citation 3)
2020-03-14/15: bans events >100 people (date unclear) - had previously banned events 1000 people or larger; Emergency declared 2020-03-18, comes into effect 2020-03-19

2020-03-16: PM says everyone should avoid office, pubs and travelling (citation 1); 2020-03-18: UK would close schools to most pupils - started 2020-03-20 (citation 2); 2020-03-20: All restaurants and indoor sport and leisure facilities were ordered to close (citation 3); 2020-03-23: restrictions tightened, gatherings banned >2 people (citation 4/5)

2020-03-09: Bans gatherings of >1000 people; 2020-03-13: Bans gatherings of >100 people; 2020-03-14: closure of non-essential businesses, schools; 2020-03-17: national lockdown starting at noon (citation 2)
2020-03-13: Spain issues state of emergency (came into effect 2020-03-14) - schools had already closed, as had cinemas, theatres and playgrounds

2020-03-16: PM says everyone should avoid office, pubs and travelling (citation 1); 2020-03-18: UK would close schools to most pupils - started 2020-03-20 (citation 2); 2020-03-20: All restaurants and indoor sport and leisure facilities were ordered to close (citation 3); 2020-03-23: restrictions tightened, gatherings banned >2 people (citation 4/5)

2020-03-13: Prime Minister "suggests" cancellation of events> 500 people (schools excluded), comes into effect 2020-03-15 (citation 1); 2020-03-18: human biosecurity emergency (national) (citation 2); 2020-30-20: governments of New South Wales and Victoria imposed a mandatory closure of non-essential services (citation 3)

2020-03-14: The national autonomous university of Mexico suspended in person classes and authorities canceled or postponed major tourist events in Guadalajara and Merida (citation 1); 2020-03-14: the Secretariat of Public Education (SEP) announced that all sporting and civic events in schools would be canceled. The same day, the Secretariat of Education announced that Easter break, originally planned from 6 to 17 April, would be extended from 20 March to 20 April as a preventive measure.[29] The; 2020-03-22: Mexico City closes bars, nightclubs, movie theatres and museums (citation 2); 2020-03-23: National Campaign of Healthy Distancing, a national program of non-pharmaceutical measures was launched

2020-01-31: Italty declares state of emergency (citation 1); 2020-02-23: Italian authorities have shut down 11 towns, mainly in the the Lombardy region (citation 2); 2020-03-08: Anyone living in Lombardy and 14 other central and northern provinces will need special permission to travel - Milan and Venice affected (citation 3); 2020-03-09: Nationwide quarantine announced (came into effect 2020-03-10, hardened 2020-03-11) (citation 4)
2020-03-13: Bans gatherings of more than 100 people (citation 2); 2020-03-14: Government ordered closing of nurseries, gyms, parks, monuments and schools (citation 1)
2020-03-12: calling organizers to cancel large indoor events
citation_1: 2020-03-13: all events >250 people are banned (per the Premier)
citation_2: City of Montreal state of emergency: 2020-03-27

pdist_notes: 2020-03-24: Chechnya became first region to close restaurants, cafes and crowded places (citation 1); 2020-03-24: Russian government adopted a number of decisions, including an instruction to regional authorities to suspend activities of night clubs, cinemas, children's entertainment centres, ban hookah smoking at restaurants and cafes; 2020-03-29: Stay at home order; 2020-03-30: Russia will close borders, Moscow enacted a citywide quarantine

2020-03-09: Bans gatherings > 1000 people; 2020-03-13: Bans gatherings of >100 people (citation 1); 2020-03-14: closure of many cultural institutions, mainly in Paris or the greater Paris region; closure of non-essential businesses; 2020-03-17: national lockdown starting at noon (citation 2)

2020-03-08: German Health Minister recommended to cancel events of more than 1000 attendees; 2020-03-10: Major events with more than 1000 people in North Rhine-Westphalia should be cancelled' 2020-03-13: German states mandate school and kindergarden closures (beginning 2020-03-16), postponing academic semesters and prohibiting visits to nursing homes. 2220-03-15: borders to neighbouring countries closed; 2020-03-22: curfew enacted, ban on gatherings of more than 2 people
2020-01-31: Italy declares state of emergency; 2020-03-10: Nationwide quarantine (announced 2020-03-09, came into effect 2020-03-10, hardened 2020-03-11) (citation 2)

2020-02-18: Universities announce plans to delay start of semester; 2020-02-21: Seoul bans public spaces and protests (preceeded by "South Korean authorities banning large gatherings, shut down educational institutions) (citation 5); ***2020-02-23***: all kindergartens, elementary schools, middle schools, high schools delay start of semester (unclear where this applies - can't translate the document) + raised the coronavirus alert to the highest level and declared a voluntary lockdown of affected cities and provinces (citation 6); 2020-02-25: Daegu officials "aggressively warning residents to take precautions, allowing private bussinesses such as restaurants to stay open" (though "customers seldom come") (citation 3); NOTE: very different strategy vs. China - aggressively monitor for infections (via testing) while keeping the city running (very thorough contact tracing, monitoring for fevers via thermal cameras; knew the original of the initial outbreak very quickly - facilitated contact tracing) - tracking "potential carriers like detectives... using mobile phone and satellite technology" - "Jeremy Konyndyk, a senior policy fellow at the Center for Global Development in Washington, said extensive testing can give countries a better picture of the extent of an outbreak. When testing in a country is limited, he said, the authorities have to take bolder actions to limit the movement of people" (citation 4)

2020-02-07: "DORSCON Orange" declared; 2020-03-20: Ban of gathering >250 people (not sure when this comes into effect); 2020-03-24: (starting 2020-03-26) Entertainment venues closed, social gatherings limited to 10 people, mass gatherings cancelled; 2020-04-03: schools, businesses to close, restaurants to be take-out only (starting 2020-04-07)

pdist_notes: 2020-03-24: Chechnya became first region to close restaurants, cafes and crowded places (citation 1); 2020-03-30: St. Petersburg accounced stay-at-home order following Moscow's quarantine

2020-03-13: Prime Minister "suggests" cancellation of events> 500 people (schools excluded), announced on 2020-03-13, comes into effect 2020-03-15 (citation 1); 2020-03-18: human biosecurity emergency (national) (citation 2); 2020-30-20: governments of New South Wales and Victoria imposed a mandatory closure of non-essential services (citation 3)

2020-02-27: schools closed (https://www.vox.com/covid-19-coronavirus-explainers/2020/3/28/21196382/japan-coronavirus-cases-covid-19-deaths-quarantine); 2020-03-02: schools close (citation 1), urge people to avoid congregating in enclosed spaces (citation 3); Has not declared state of emergency (as of 2020-03-30) (citation 2)
PH emergency declared 2020-03-17

2020-03-10: Anschober (Health Minister) explained that as of Wednesday, outdoor events with over 500 participants and indoor events with over 100 participants will be canceled by decree until the beginning of April; Austria closes schools; Universities would close their classes at the latest by 2020-03-16; children > 14 ordered to stay home starting 2020-03-15, younger children starting 2020-03-17 (citation 1/2);  2020-03-15: ban announced for public gatherings of more than 5 people, restaurants ordered to closed by 2020-03-17; 2020-03-15: governor of Tyrol accounced a one-week lockdown for the whole province (citation 3); 2020-03-16:  nationwide - homes may only be left for one of few reasons (citation 4)
